author: Dennis Kamariki
title: Zetech coach Obilo blames ‚Äòrains‚Äô for recent slump
text:
Zetech Sparks head coach Maurice Obilo has blamed inadequate training as one of the major challenges affecting the team currently in the Kenya National Women‚Äôs Basketball League.
The students lost 86-68 to defending champions and league leaders Kenya Ports Authority (KPA) last weekend, a defeat Obilo is linking to poor training due to the ongoing heavy rains in the country.
Zetech are currently second on the log with 38 points after 20 matches with two games to go in the regular league, six points behind league leaders KPA, who are done with the regular league season waiting for the season-end playoffs.
‚ÄúThe girls did well, we played at our level best, because we did what we could and everything that we wanted to do worked for us. Lack of practicing is what hurt us in that game as we are training in the outdoors and the rains could not allow us to train well for the past one month but we came out and did what we could and played to our level best,‚Äù Obilo said.
Obilo has however backed his charges to bounce back.
‚ÄúI am proud of the girls, I am proud of the effort they are putting in, they are just amazing girls. With time, if the rains allow us, we will go back to our routine of training and we will definitely give better performance in the next games.‚Äù
Elsewhere, UON Dynamites head coach Eugene Kalman has taken issue with their opponent for not showing up on Saturday and giving them a walkover in another women‚Äôs premier league match.
Dynamites, who were away in Nakuru to face home side The Swish, were left unhappy when the home team failed to honour the fixture.
Kalman said it was a waste of time and resources for them and such behaviour should not happen again as it lowers the morale of players and credibility of the league.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a shame, we used resources to prepare, travel then they didn‚Äôt show up. It‚Äôs very unprofessional. Apparently the team only has players from Nairobi, which is unfortunate as it‚Äôs a Nakuru based team.
‚ÄúSuch a team needs to use local-based players and not depend on players from Nairobi because if locals can‚Äôt get this opportunity to represent Nakuru, when will they ever get a chance. We need to develop players,‚Äù Kalman said.
The Dynamites are eighth on the log with 26 points from 18 matches. They have won seven and lost 12 so far with four games to go.

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text:
NATION 20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist Mary Walrath-Holdridge USA TODAY A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her.
The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and Molldrem Family Dentistry caused her significant injury that is still being corrected.
According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement.
Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up.
Treatment called 'inconceivable' Gypsy Rose Blanchard released from Missouri prison early Thursday morning, DOC confirms Cher files for conservatorship of her son, claims Elijah Blue Allman's life is 'at risk' Ex-boyfriend of missing St. Louis woman admits to her murder after Wisconsin arrest: Police 6 dead, 3 injured in Johnson County, Texas, crash; victims include 2 young kids ages 9, 10 California Pizza Huts lay off all delivery drivers ahead of minimum wage increase ‚ÄúIt is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,‚Äù wrote Dr. Avrum Goldstein, a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit.
Goldstein, who is a faculty member at NOVA Southeastern University , also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment.
"[Wilson‚Äôs] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,‚Äù he said in his report. ‚ÄúTrying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.‚Äù
Doctors remove wrong organ from man: They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.
The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg.
‚ÄúAny negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote.
Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem‚Äôs ‚Äúnegligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages.
Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo llega a los 900 goles en su carrera
text:
Cristiano Ronaldo logr√≥ a sus 39 a√±os el gol n√∫mero 900 de su carrera, esto luego de que Portugal se impuso 2-1 a Croacia este jueves en el Estadio da Luz de Lisboa, en la apertura de su grupo de la
Liga de Naciones de la UEFA.
La escuadra portuguesa consigui√≥ su triunfo sobre la vigente subcampeona del torneo gracias a su efectividad en la primera parte, donde fue claramente superior.
Los locales abrieron el marcador en el minuto 7 por medio de Diogo Dalot, que culmin√≥ una gran acci√≥n colectiva tras una asistencia de Bruno Fernandes. Sin embargo, Dalot vivi√≥ una sensaci√≥n totalmente opuesta en el 41, cuando escribi√≥ en contra.
Te podr√≠a interesar:
Clubes y periodistas solicitan donadores de sangre para Andr√© Mar√≠n
Antes de ello, Cristiano Ronaldo hab√≠a anotado en el 34 para llegar a esa cifra de 900 goles en su carrera, fue con un potente disparo gracias a un centro perfecto de Nuno Mendes.
Ese objetivo era uno de los alicientes con los que se presentaba este partido para el jugador de 39 a√±os que milit√≥ las dos √∫ltimas temporadas en Arabia Saudita y que parece cerca del retiro de las canchas.
Portugal sigui√≥ disponiendo de las mejores ocasiones, pero no consigui√≥ materializarlas ante una Croacia que en la parte final intent√≥ ser m√°s ofensiva, pero sin fortuna.
Cristiano Ronaldo fall√≥ una buena ocasi√≥n en el 76 para haber anotado su gol 901, despu√©s de ello fue reemplazado a falta de unos minutos para el final por Diogo Jota.
Te podr√≠a interesar:

Este partido en el campo del Benfica sirvi√≥ adem√°s para que el futbol portugu√©s homenajeara a Pepe, que a sus 41 a√±os acaba de retirarse, despu√©s de haber jugado 17 a√±os con la selecci√≥n nacional. Pepe estuvo con el equipo en la reciente Eurocopa, donde Francia les cort√≥ el paso en los cuartos de final.
En la segunda jornada, el domingo, Portugal recibir√° a Escocia y Croacia jugar√° como local contra Polonia.
(Con Informaci√≥n de AFP)

author: El Caribe
title: Fuerza del Pueblo: ‚ÄúPRM ha quebrado peque√±os y medianos productores‚Äù
text: Santo Domingo, RD.- La Fuerza del Pueblo, que encabeza el expresidente Leonel Fern√°ndez, manifest√≥ este jueves su rechazo al proyecto de ley aprobado el mi√©rcoles por la C√°mara de Diputados, que grava con tasa cero la importaci√≥n de alimentos. A trav√©s de un comunicado, la organizaci√≥n pol√≠tica indic√≥ que el Gobierno del [ Partido Revolucionario Moderno (PRM) ](https://www.elcaribe.com.do/opiniones/utilizacion-fondos-publicos-por-el-prm-en-las-elecciones-del-card/)ha trasformado el pa√≠s de productor a importador de alimentos, llevando a la quiebra a quebrando los peque√±os y medianos productores. De igual forma, acus√≥ al Gobierno de disminuir el poder adquisitivo de los consumidores por el aumento ‚Äúdesproporcionado‚Äù de los precios de los alimentos. Comunicado √≠ntegro de la Fuerza del Pueblo El martes 26 de esta semana la Comisi√≥n de Haciendas de la [C√°mara de Diputados](https://www.camaradediputados.gob.do/app/app_2011/cd_frontpage.aspx) aprob√≥ un informe favorable al Proyecto de Ley sometido el 2 de octubre del presente a√±o 2023 por el Presidente Lu√≠s Abinader para darle potestad al gobierno de aplicar Tasa Cero de Arancel durante un per√≠odo de seis (6) meses a la importaci√≥n de cualquier alimento de la canasta b√°sica familiar sin la necesidad de recurrir al congreso. Desde su ascenso al poder el gobierno del PRM ha mostrado una voracidad importadora que pr√°cticamente ha trasformado el pa√≠s de productor a importador de alimentos, quebrando los peque√±os y medianos productores y disminuyendo el poder adquisitivo de los consumidores debido al incremento desproporcionado de los precios de los alimentos. Muestra de ello fue la aprobaci√≥n en abril de 2022 de la inoportuna Ley No. 6-22 o Tasa Cero mediante la cual se grav√≥ con cero aranceles la importaci√≥n de 67 productos alimenticios durante 6 meses bajo el argumento de abaratar los precios y disminuir la inflaci√≥n, a pesar de la oposici√≥n expresada por todas las federaciones y asociaciones de productores, agro empresarios y la sociedad civil en general. La referida ley, adem√°s de no lograr su objetivo de disminuir la inflaci√≥n, caus√≥ un impacto negativo en los productores agropecuarios al importar rubros en los que el pa√≠s es autosuficiente y en los que no lo somos haci√©ndolo en ocasiones que coincid√≠an con la cosecha, afectando la comercializaci√≥n y la rentabilidad de la producci√≥n nacional. Por el contrario, la misma favoreci√≥ a unos 170 empresarios importadores que se beneficiaron con una exenci√≥n arancelaria superior a los 1,700 millones de pesos seg√∫n informaron las autoridades. Resultado de esta mala pol√≠tica del gobierno, las importaciones de alimentos se incrementaron en 2,118 millones de d√≥lares (68 %) al pasar de 3,109 millones en 2019 a 5,227 millones de d√≥lares en 2022; y se estima que este a√±o 2023 duplicar√°n las del 2019, es decir, m√°s de 6,000 millones de d√≥lares. En su ofuscaci√≥n reeleccionista, el Presidente Luis Abinader con este nuevo Proyecto de Ley Tasa Cero pretende seguir favoreciendo a sus allegados pol√≠ticos a costa de hundir la producci√≥n agropecuaria del pa√≠s, hacer desparecer los peque√±os y medianos productores y seguir castigado a los consumidores con precios altos de los alimentos. Finalmente, Fuerza del Pueblo expresa su rotundo rechazo a este nuevo proyecto de ley por considerarlo nefasto y advierte sobre el fuerte impacto econ√≥mico y social negativo que el mismo tendr√≠a para el pa√≠s; y al mismo tiempo, hace un llamado urgente al gobierno para que, en lugar de importar alimentos, aplique pol√≠ticas p√∫blicas, proyectos y programas orientados a apoyar e incentivar la producci√≥n nacional para que los productores tengan rentabilidad y para que el pueblo pueda comer barato.

author: BILL BULEY
title: Dogs abandoned in Coeur d'Alene home | Coeur d'Alene Press
text: Dogs abandoned in Coeur d'Alene home Kristina Jensen gives Bessie a hug as the Great Dane mix stands by Addy at Companions Animal Center on Thursday. BILL BULEY/Press Addy gives a kiss to Kristina Jensen at Companions Animal Center on Thursday. Bessie, with her ribs visible, looks around at Companions Animal Center on Thursday. [Previous](#slider) [Next](#slider) [BILL BULEY](/staff/bill-buley/) Staff Writer | August 30, 2024 1:09 AM A water leak is being credited with saving the lives of two dogs left in a garbage-filled Coeur d'Alene house. ‚ÄúTheir only water source was a leaking toilet,‚Äù said Kristina Jensen, dog technician at Companions Animal Center. ‚ÄúThat's probably why they‚Äôre still alive is because of that leaking toilet.‚Äù The dogs, a young Great Dane/boxer mix and a 10-year-old pit bull mix, are believed to have survived in the home for about a month before they were rescued. Jensen said the dogs were very thin and malnourished when they arrived at the shelter about 10 days ago. The larger one named Bessie weighed about 50 pounds, but for her size should have been around 80 pounds, Jensen said. The smaller one, Addy, weighed about 35 pounds and should have been about 50. Jensen said the dogs endured difficult conditions, as temperatures were in the 90s on several days they were trapped in the filthy home. Their only food was leftovers and trash scattered throughout the home. The home was also filled with animal waste, creating a strong stench, and the dogs were caked in mud and waste. ‚ÄúIt was amazing how bad it was," said Vicky Nelson, CAC development director. ‚ÄúI mean, we‚Äôve seen awful.‚Äù It's believed the dogs were left alone for more than a month because of a date found on a delivered package outside the home. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs amazing they survived,‚Äù Nelson said Thursday. The dogs are improving. Addy remains skittish but is starting to open up more, Jensen said. Ironically, Addy was adopted at the shelter about 10 years ago. Bessie was lethargic when she arrived but has regained some strength, though her ribs are still visible. Her teeth are those of a much older dog, and her ears were brown instead of pink, Jensen said. Both dogs were wary Thursday but tails occasionally wagged as they stood in a fenced outside area of CAC. ‚ÄúThat's the kicker of it all. They‚Äôre so sweet and they still have so much trust for us even after all they went through,‚Äù Jensen said. ‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt trust anybody who let me sit there in a house and starve for a month.‚Äù Tales of abandoned dogs nationwide are not rare. A headline from a recent story read: ‚ÄúAbandoned dog found tied to bench with ‚ÄòHeartbreaking' note." Two from earlier this year read: ‚ÄúAbandoned dog patiently waits on porch for owners who moved away,‚Äù while another was ‚ÄúAbandoned dog learns to trust again after making a special friend.‚Äù According to the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, of about 6.3 million companion animals who enter shelters nationwide every year, about 3.1 million are dogs and 3.2 million are cats. Nelson previously told The Press that reasons given by people wishing to surrender a pet generally are connected to money and moving. With the rising cost of housing, many are forced to give up their pets. "It's not supposed to be that way," Jensen said. CAC continues to operate at capacity, with nearly 50 dogs there Thursday, and it continues to have a waiting list for people wishing to surrender pets. Jensen said the shelter‚Äôs veterinarians developed a treatment plan for Bessie and Addy and they may be available for adoption in about a month when they have regained their health. ‚ÄúIt depends on how they‚Äôre doing,‚Äù she said. Coeur d'Alene animal control contacted the dogs' owner, who could face animal cruelty charges, Jensen said. The name of the dogs‚Äô owner was not released.

author: Binance News
title: AI-Generated Code Raises Security Concerns in Blockchain Development
text:
According to PANews, a Twitter user identified as @r_cky0 reported a significant security breach while using ChatGPT to develop a blockchain automated trading bot. The user discovered that the AI-recommended code contained a hidden backdoor, which transmitted private keys to a phishing website, resulting in a loss of approximately $2,500. This incident was later confirmed by SlowMist founder Yu Jian, known as @evilcos, who acknowledged the existence of such vulnerabilities in AI-generated code.
Experts have highlighted that these types of attacks may stem from AI models learning malicious patterns from phishing posts or insecure content. Current AI models face challenges in detecting backdoors within code, raising concerns about the reliability of AI-generated programming solutions. Industry professionals are urging users to exercise caution and avoid blindly trusting AI-generated code. They also recommend that AI platforms enhance their content review mechanisms to identify and alert users to potential security risks. This call for increased vigilance and improved safety measures underscores the need for a more secure approach to integrating AI in software development.

author: Nick Carlisle ‚Ä¢
title: Indiana transfer athlete Jaylin Lucas commits to Florida State
text:
Florida State earned its second transfer commit on Sunday with the commitment of Indiana transfer athlete Jaylin Lucas. A kick return specialist and running back at Indiana, Lucas is the younger brother of current Seminoles wide receiver Ja'Khi Douglas.
"It mean a lot to have an open relationship with Coach YAC (David Johnson) and Coach Norvell," Lucas said. "Sitting down and seeing the scheme, it really played a key part in me coming here and being a part of the Noles family."
In two seasons at Indiana, Lucas has rushed for 546 yards and four touchdowns on 116 carries. He also has 329 receiving yards out of the backfield.
"They see me contributing big on special teams," Lucas said. "They evaluated me a big role in the offense. Probably be all over the field."
Advertisement At 5'9, 170 pounds, Lucas is one of the most lethal kick returners in the country - being named an All-American kick returner by multiple outlets. Lucas has 1,163 return yards and three touchdowns in two seasons.
"I feel like I can bring my skillset here and be a huge factor to what's going on here," Lucas said. "They got guys here but I just want to be a part of time that's willing to die hard and go out and work each and every day."
Lucas is the sixth transfer commit for the Seminoles in the early period and he joins the Seminoles with two years of eligibility left and a possible third year should he redshirt at any point. Most importantly for Lucas, he gets to reunite with his brother.
"I'm very excited to reunite with my brother," Lucas said. "That's all I wanted to do really. He taught me everything that I know and he played a huge factor in my recruiting process and learning the game of football."
